simpledb

Class Delete

  • java.lang.Object
    • simpledb.AbstractDbIterator
      • simpledb.Delete
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DbIterator

    public class Delete
extends AbstractDbIterator
    The delete operator. Delete reads tuples from its child operator and removes them from the table they belong to.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Delete(TransactionId t, DbIterator child)
      Constructor specifying the transaction that this delete belongs to as well as the child to read from.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      If subclasses override this, they should call super.close().
      TupleDesc getTupleDesc()
      Returns the TupleDesc associated with this DbIterator.
      void open()
      Opens the iterator.
      protected Tuple readNext()
      Deletes tuples as they are read from the child operator.
      void rewind()
      Resets the iterator to the start.

      • Methods inherited from class simpledb.AbstractDbIterator

      • Delete

        public Delete(TransactionId t,
              DbIterator child)
        Constructor specifying the transaction that this delete belongs to as well as the child to read from.
        Parameters:
        t - The transaction this delete runs in
        child - The child operator from which to read tuples for deletion

      • readNext

        protected Tuple readNext()
                  throws TransactionAbortedException,
                         DbException
        Deletes tuples as they are read from the child operator. Deletes are processed via the buffer pool (which can be access via the Database.getBufferPool() method.
        Specified by:
        readNext in class AbstractDbIterator
        Returns:
        A 1-field tuple containing the number of deleted records.
        Throws:
        TransactionAbortedException
        DbException
        See Also:
        Database.getBufferPool(), BufferPool.deleteTuple(simpledb.TransactionId, simpledb.Tuple)
